member.name: T:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.BreezeNHControllerAttribute
member.summary: Applies the BreezeNHQueryableAttribute to all controller methods except those that already have a QueryableAttribute or an ODataQueryOptions parameter.

member.name: T:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.BreezeNHQueryableAttribute
member.summary: Override the EnableBreezeQueryAttribute to use NHQueryHelper, which applies OData syntax to NHibernate queries. Use this attribute on each method in your WebApi controller that uses Nhibernate's IQueryable.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.BreezeNHQueryableAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Sets HandleNullPropagation = false on the base class. Otherwise it's true for non-EF, and that complicates the query expressions and breaks NH's query parser.

member.name: T:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHibernateProxyJsonConverter
member.summary: JsonConverter for handling NHibernate proxies. Only serializes the object if it is initialized, i.e. the proxied object has been loaded.

member.name: T:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHIncludingContractResolver
member.summary: Newtonsoft.Json ContractResolver that can be configured to include properties by name. Allows JSON serializer to skip certain properties, thus preventing the serializer from trying to serialize the entire object graph. Uses the ClassMetaData from the SessionFactory to determine which types should be serialized by default. Excludes association properties by default, unless explicitly included.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHIncludingContractResolver.#ctor(NHibernate.ISessionFactory,System.String[])
member.summary: Configure the included property names using an array of strings
member.param: Names of properties to be included

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHIncludingContractResolver.#ctor(NHibernate.ISessionFactory,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String}})
member.summary: Configure the included property names using a dictionary of { Type -> List of property names to include }

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHIncludingContractResolver.GetSerializableMembers(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the list of property and field names that should be serialized on a given type.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHIncludingContractResolver.IsIncluded(NHibernate.Metadata.IClassMetadata,System.Type,System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: For a given property type, containing type, and property name, return true if it should be serialized and false if not. By default, value types and system types are serialized, but collections and custom types are not.

member.name: T:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.ExcludingContractResolver
member.summary: Newtonsoft.Json ContractResolver that can be configured to exclude certain properties by name. Allows JSON serializer to skip certain properties, thus preventing the serializer from trying to serialize the entire object graph.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.ExcludingContractResolver.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Define the properties that should be excluded. Two different methods can be used: 1. The simple property name, e.g. "Orders". This will exclude properties with that name from anywhere in the object graph. 2. The declaring type name + '.' + property name, e.g. "Customer.Orders". This will exclude the property name from that type only.

member.name: T:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.IncludingContractResolver
member.summary: Newtonsoft.Json ContractResolver that can be configured to include properties by name. Allows JSON serializer to skip certain properties, thus preventing the serializer from trying to serialize the entire object graph. Serializes value types and System types by default, but excludes all collections and other types unless explicitly included.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.IncludingContractResolver.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Configure the included property names using an array of strings
member.param: Names of properties to be included

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.IncludingContractResolver.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String}})
member.summary: Configure the included property names using a dictionary of { Type -> List of property names to include }

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.IncludingContractResolver.GetSerializableMembers(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the list of property and field names that should be serialized on a given type.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.IncludingContractResolver.IsIncluded(System.Type,System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: For a given property type, containing type, and property name, return true if it should be serialized and false if not. By default, value types and system types are serialized, but collections and custom types are not.

member.name: T:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHibernateContractResolver
member.summary: Newtonsoft.Json ContractResolver for NHibernate objects. Allows JSON serializer to skip properties that are not already resolved, thus preventing the serializer from trying to serialize the entire object graph. Code copied from https://github.com/PeteGoo/NHibernate.QueryService

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHibernateContractResolver.CreateProperty(System.Reflection.MemberInfo,Newtonsoft.Json.MemberSerialization)
member.summary: Control serialization NHibernate collections by using JsonProperty.ShouldSerialize. Serialization should only be attempted on collections that are initialized.

member.name: T:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.TypeContractResolver
member.summary: Newtonsoft.Json ContractResolver that only includes certain types from a given assembly. All other types from that assembly are excluded. This allows control over which custom types are serialized.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.TypeContractResolver.#ctor(System.Type[])
member.summary: Define included types. All other types from the same assembly as the first type will be excluded.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.TypeContractResolver.#ctor(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Type})
member.summary: Define the assembly and the included types. All other types from the assembly will be excluded.

member.name: T:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHBreezeMetadata
member.summary: Builds a data structure containing the metadata required by Breeze.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHBreezeMetadata.BuildMetadata
member.summary: Build the Breeze metadata as a nested Dictionary. The result can be converted to JSON and sent to the Breeze client.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHBreezeMetadata.InitMap
member.summary: Populate the metadata header.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHBreezeMetadata.AddClass(NHibernate.Metadata.IClassMetadata)
member.summary: Add the metadata for an entity.
Add the properties for an entity.

will be populated with the navigation properties of the entity

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHBreezeMetadata.AddComponent(NHibernate.Type.ComponentType,System.Collections.Generic.List{NHibernate.Mapping.ISelectable})
member.summary: Adds a complex type definition
member.param: The complex type
The columns which the complex type spans. These are used to get the length and defaultValues
member.returns: The class name and namespace in the form "Location:#Breeze.Nhibernate.NorthwindIBModel"

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHBreezeMetadata.MakeDataProperty(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,NHibernate.Mapping.Column,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Make data property metadata for the entity
member.param: name of the property on the server
data type of the property, e.g. Int32
whether the property is nullable in the database
Column object, used for maxLength and defaultValue
true if this property is part of the key for the entity
true if this property contains the version of the entity (for a concurrency strategy)

member.summary: Make association property metadata for the entity. Also populates the _fkMap which is used for related-entity fixup in NHContext.FixupRelationships

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHBreezeMetadata.GetPropertyColumnNames(NHibernate.Persister.Entity.AbstractEntityPersister,System.String)
member.summary: Get the column names for a given property as a comma-delimited string of unbracketed names.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHBreezeMetadata.UnBracket(System.String)
member.summary: Get the column name without square brackets or quotes around it. E.g. "[OrderID]" -> OrderID Because sometimes Hibernate gives us brackets, and sometimes it doesn't. Double-quotes happen with SQL CE.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHBreezeMetadata.GetEntityType(System.Type,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the Breeze name of the entity type. For collections, Breeze expects the name of the element type.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHBreezeMetadata.Pluralize(System.String)
member.summary: lame pluralizer. Assumes we just need to add a suffix.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHBreezeMetadata.GetAssociationName(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an association name from two entity names. For consistency, puts the entity names in alphabetical order.
member.param: if true, adds the one-to-one suffix

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHContext.#ctor(NHibernate.ISession)
member.summary: Create a new context for the given session. Each thread should have its own NHContext and Session.
member.param: Used for queries and updates
Used for metadata generation

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHContext.#ctor(Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHContext)
member.summary: Creates a new context using the session and metadata from the sourceContext
member.param: source of the Session and metadata used by this new context.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHContext.GetQuery``1(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Return a query for the given entity
member.param: Whether to mark the query Cacheable. Default is false.

member.summary: Return a cacheable query for the given entity, using the given cache region

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHContext.Close
member.summary: Close the session

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHContext.Dispose
member.summary: Close the session

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHContext.CloseDbConnection
member.summary: Close the session and its associated db connection

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHContext.BeforeSaveEntityGraph(System.Collections.Generic.List{Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo})
member.summary: Allows subclasses to process entities before they are saved. This method is called after BeforeSaveEntities(saveMap), and before any session.Save methods are called. The foreign-key associations on the entities have been resolved, relating the entities to each other, and attaching proxies for other many-to-one associations.
member.param: List of entities in the order they will be saved
member.returns: The same entitiesToPersist. Overrides of this method may modify the list.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHContext.BeforeSaveEntity(Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo)
member.summary: If TypeFilter function is defined, returns TypeFilter(entityInfo.Entity.GetType())
member.returns: true if the entity should be saved, false if not

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHContext.SaveChangesCore(Breeze.ContextProvider.SaveWorkState)
member.summary: Persist the changes to the entities in the saveMap. This implements the abstract method in ContextProvider. Assigns saveWorkState.KeyMappings, which map the temporary keys to their real generated keys. Note that this method sets session.FlushMode = FlushMode.Never, so manual flushes are required.
member.param: Map of Type -> List of entities of that type

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHContext.GetRelationshipFixer(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.List{Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo}})
member.summary: Get a new NHRelationshipFixer using the saveMap and the foreign-key map from the metadata.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHContext.ProcessSaves(System.Collections.Generic.List{Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo})
member.summary: Persist the changes to the entities in the saveOrder.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHContext.ProcessEntity(Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo,NHibernate.Metadata.IClassMetadata)
member.summary: Add, update, or delete the entity according to its EntityState.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHContext.RestoreOldVersionValue(Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo,NHibernate.Metadata.IClassMetadata)
member.summary: Restore the old value of the concurrency column so Hibernate will save the entity. Otherwise it will complain because Breeze has already changed the value.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHContext.AddKeyMapping(Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo,System.Type,NHibernate.Metadata.IClassMetadata)
member.summary: Record the value of the temporary key in EntityKeyMapping

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHContext.GetIdentifier(System.Object,NHibernate.Metadata.IClassMetadata)
member.summary: Get the identifier value for the entity. If the entity does not have an identifier property, or natural identifiers defined, then the entity itself is returned.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHContext.GetIdentifierAsArray(System.Object,NHibernate.Metadata.IClassMetadata)
member.summary: Get the identier value for the entity as an object[]. This is needed for creating an EntityError.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHContext.UpdateAutoGeneratedKeys(System.Collections.Generic.List{Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo})
member.summary: Update the KeyMappings with their real values.

members.member:
Refresh the entities from the database. This picks up changes due to triggers, etc.
TODO make this faster TODO make this optional

member.name: P:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHContext.TypeFilter
member.summary: Sets a function to filter types from metadata generation and SaveChanges. The function returns true if a Type should be included, false otherwise.
member.example: // exclude the LogRecord entity MyNHContext.TypeFilter = (type) => type.Name != "LogRecord";

member.name: T:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHEagerFetch
member.summary: Converts OData-style $expand clauses into NHibernate Fetch commands. Adapted from NhQueryableEnumeratorAttribute.cs found in https://github.com/PeteGoo/NHibernate.QueryService

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHEagerFetch.ApplyExpansions(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.String,Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.ExpandTypeMap,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add the Fetch clauses to the query according to the given expand paths
member.param: The query to expand
Comma-separated list of properties to expand. May include nested paths of the form "Property/SubProperty"
Provides the NHibernate metadata for the classes
Will be populated with the names of the expanded properties for each type.

If true, eagerly fetch collections. Caution: this causes problems with $skip and $top operations. Default is false. expandMap will still be populated with the collection property, so it will be lazy loaded. Be sure to set default_batch_fetch_size in the configuration for lazy loaded collections.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHEagerFetch.ApplyExpansions(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.String[],Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.ExpandTypeMap,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add the Fetch clauses to the query according to the given expand paths
member.param: The query to expand
The names of the properties to expand. May include nested paths of the form "Property/SubProperty"
Provides the NHibernate metadata for the classes
Will be populated with the names of the expanded properties for each type.

If true, eagerly fetch collections. Caution: this causes problems with $skip and $top operations. Default is false. expandMap will still be populated with the collection property, so it will be lazy loaded. Be sure to set default_batch_fetch_size in the configuration for lazy loaded collections.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHEagerFetch.MapExpansions(System.Type,System.String[])
member.summary: Create an ExpandTypeMap populated according to the expandPaths.
member.param: The type of the root element.
The names of the properties to expand. May include nested paths of the form "Property/SubProperty"

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHEagerFetch.MapExpansions(System.Type,System.String[],Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.ExpandTypeMap)
member.summary: Create an ExpandTypeMap populated according to the expandPaths.
member.param: The type of the root element.
The names of the properties to expand. May include nested paths of the form "Property/SubProperty"
Will be populated with the names of the expanded properties for each type. If null, a new one is created.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHEagerFetch.ApplyExpansions(NHibernate.ICriteria,System.String[],NHibernate.ISessionFactory,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String}})
member.summary: Add the Fetch clauses to the query according to the given expand paths, using the ICriteria API
member.param: The query to expand
The names of the properties to expand. May include nested paths of the form "Property/SubProperty"
Provides the NHibernate metadata for the classes
If provided, will be populated with the names of the expanded properties for each type.

member.name: T:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.ExpandTypeMap
member.summary: Keeps track of the types and methods used by a query, so it can control the lazy loaded in the JsonFormatter.

member.name: T:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHExpander
member.summary:
Initializes Hibernate proxies and collections prior to serialization. This is used to implement the OData $expand operation.
Be sure to set the default_batch_fetch_size property in your NH config file (or Web.config), e.g.
<property name="default_batch_fetch_size">32</property>
so that lazy loading happens in batches, instead of one at a time.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHExpander.InitializeList(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String[])
member.summary: Cause initialization of properties on the objects in the collection. The properties to initialize are specified in the expandPaths. For example, if roots is a collection of Orders, expandPaths might be [ "Customer", "OrderDetails/Product/Supplier" ]
member.param: Collection of Hibernate-mapped objects
properties relative to the roots

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHExpander.InitializeObjectPath(System.Object,System.String[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Recursively forces loading of each Hibernate proxy in the tree that matches an entry in the expandPath.
member.param: Top-level object containing the properties
Path of properties to initialize for each type
Where we are in the path

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHExpander.SplitPaths(System.String[])
member.summary: Split the strings into their path components. E.g. "OrderDetails/Product" becomes [ "OrderDetails", "Product" ]

member.summary: Recursively forces loading of each NHibernate proxy in the tree that matches an entry in the map.
member.param: Top-level collection of objects
Properties to initialize for each type

member.summary: Recursively forces loading of each NHibernate proxy in the tree that matches an entry in the map.
member.param: Top-level collection of objects
Properties to initialize for each type

member.summary: Recursively forces loading of each NHibernate proxy in the tree that matches an entry in the map.
member.param: Top-level collection of objects
Map of properties to initialize for each type
How deep to follow the tree; prevents infinite looping

member.name: T:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.Metadata
member.summary: Metadata describing the entity model. Converted to JSON to send to Breeze client.

member.name: F:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.Metadata.ForeignKeyMap
member.summary: Map of relationship name -> foreign key name, e.g. "Customer" -> "CustomerID". Used for re-establishing the entity relationships from the foreign key values during save. This part is not sent to the client because it is separate from the base dictionary implementation.

member.name: T:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NhQueryableInclude`1
member.summary:
Extends NhQueryable to add an Include function.
Include supports the OData $expand implementation, which retrieves related entities by following navigation properties. Note that Include is not the same as Fetch. Fetch performs a join operation, while Include causes as second query. Fetch can be faster, but Include preserves the row count sematics of the original query.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NhQueryableInclude`1.#ctor(NHibernate.Engine.ISessionImplementor,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Create a query which may be marked cachable.
Calls the base constructor, setting the Expression using NhQueryable. Needed because the NHibernate Linq parser chokes if NhQueryableInclude is in the expression.
member.remarks: Note that some combinations of operations (.Select with .Where) result in errors from the NHibernate LINQ provider when using cacheable queries.
member.param: Session
True to set the query as cachable, false as not cacheable. Defaults to false.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NhQueryableInclude`1.#ctor(NHibernate.Engine.ISessionImplementor,System.String)
member.summary:
Create a cacheable query using the given cache region.
Calls the base constructor, setting the Expression using NhQueryable. Needed because the NHibernate Linq parser chokes if NhQueryableInclude is in the expression.
member.remarks: Note that some combinations of operations (.Select with .Where) result in errors from the NHibernate LINQ provider when using cacheable queries.
member.param: Session
Cache Region to use for caching the query. and

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHQueryHelper.BeforeApplyQuery(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataQueryOptions)
member.summary: Before applying the queryOptions to the queryable, perform special processing to handle $expand and work around the NHibernate IQueryable limitations

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHQueryHelper.NHApplyExpand(Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.IQueryableInclude)
member.summary: Saves the expand path strings from queryable.GetIncludes(), for later lazy initialization and serialization.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHQueryHelper.NHApplyExpand(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataQueryOptions)
member.summary: Saves the expand path string from the queryOptions, for later lazy initialization and serialization.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHQueryHelper.ApplyExpand(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataQueryOptions)
member.summary: Override ApplyExpand to do nothing. NHApplyExpand takes care of expands for NH, and it is executed earlier in the query processing (in BeforeApplyQuery)

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHQueryHelper.GetSession(System.Linq.IQueryable)
member.summary: Get the ISession from the IQueryable.
member.returns: the session if queryable.Provider is NHibernate.Linq.DefaultQueryProvider, else null

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHQueryHelper.PostExecuteQuery(System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Perform the lazy loading allowed in the expandPaths.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHQueryHelper.ConfigureFormatter(System.Net.Http.Formatting.JsonMediaTypeFormatter,System.Linq.IQueryable)
member.summary: Configure the JsonFormatter to limit the object serialization of the response. Even with no IQueryable, we still need to configure the formatter to prevent runaway serialization. We have to rely on the controller to close the session in this case.
member.param: Used to obtain the ISession

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHQueryHelper.ConfigureFormatter(System.Net.Http.Formatting.JsonMediaTypeFormatter,NHibernate.ISession)
member.summary: Configure the JsonFormatter to limit the object serialization of the response.
member.param: request.GetConfiguration().Formatters.JsonFormatter
If not null, will be closed by this method. Otherwise, the session must be closed by the Controller.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHQueryHelper.Close(System.Object)
member.summary: Release any resources associated with this QueryHelper.
member.param: Response payload, which may have associated resources.

member.name: T:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHRelationshipFixer
member.summary:
Utility class for re-establishing the relationships between entities prior to saving them in Nhibernate.
Breeze requires many-to-one relationships to have properties both the related entity and its ID, and it sends only the ID in the save bundle. To make it work with NH, we map the many-to-one entity, and map the foreign key ID with insert="false" update="false" , so the many-to-one entity must be populated in order for the foreign key value to be saved in the DB. To work around this problem, this class uses the IDs sent by Breeze to re-connect the related entities.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHRelationshipFixer.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.List{Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo}},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String},NHibernate.ISession)
member.summary: Create new instance with the given saveMap and fkMap. Since the saveMap is unique per save, this instance will be useful for processing one entire save bundle only.
member.param: Map of entity types -> entity instances to save. This is provided by Breeze in the SaveChanges call.
Map of relationship name -> foreign key name. This is built in the NHBreezeMetadata class.
NHibernate session that will save the entities

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHRelationshipFixer.FixupRelationships
member.summary: Connect the related entities in the saveMap to other entities. If the related entities are not in the saveMap, they are loaded from the session.
member.returns: The list of entities in the order they should be save, according to their relationships.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHRelationshipFixer.RemoveRelationships
member.summary: Remove the navigations between entities in the saveMap. This flattens the JSON result so Breeze can handle it.
member.param: Map of entity types -> entity instances to save

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHRelationshipFixer.AddToGraph(Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo,Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo)
member.summary: Add the relationship to the dependencyGraph
member.param: Entity that depends on parent (e.g. has a many-to-one relationship to parent)
Entity that child depends on (e.g. one parent has one-to-many children)

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHRelationshipFixer.SortDependencies
member.summary: Sort the entries in the dependency graph according to their dependencies.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHRelationshipFixer.AddToSaveOrder(Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo,System.Int32)
member.summary: Recursively add entities to the saveOrder or deleteOrder according to their dependencies
member.param: Entity to be added. Its dependencies will be added depth-first.
prevents infinite recursion in case of cyclic dependencies

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHRelationshipFixer.ProcessRelationships
member.summary: Add or remove the entity relationships according to the removeMode.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHRelationshipFixer.ProcessRelationships(Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo,NHibernate.Metadata.IClassMetadata)
member.summary: Connect the related entities based on the foreign key values. Note that this may cause related entities to be loaded from the DB if they are not already in the session.
member.param: Entity that will be saved
Metadata about the entity type

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHRelationshipFixer.ProcessRelationship(System.String,NHibernate.Type.IType,Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo,NHibernate.Metadata.IClassMetadata)
member.summary: Handle a specific property if it is a Association or Component relationship.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHRelationshipFixer.FixupComponentRelationships(System.String,NHibernate.Type.ComponentType,Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo,NHibernate.Metadata.IClassMetadata)
member.summary: Connect the related entities based on the foreign key values found in a component type. This updates the values of the component's properties.
member.param: Name of the (component) property of the entity. May be null if the property is the entity's identifier.
Type of the component
Breeze EntityInfo
Metadata for the entity class

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHRelationshipFixer.FixupRelationship(System.String,NHibernate.Type.EntityType,Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo,NHibernate.Metadata.IClassMetadata)
member.summary: Set an association value based on the value of the foreign key. This updates the property of the entity.
member.param: Name of the navigation/association property of the entity, e.g. "Customer". May be null if the property is the entity's identifier.
Type of the property
Breeze EntityInfo
Metadata for the entity class

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHRelationshipFixer.GetRelatedEntity(System.String,NHibernate.Type.EntityType,Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo,NHibernate.Metadata.IClassMetadata)
member.summary: Get a related entity based on the value of the foreign key. Attempts to find the related entity in the saveMap; if its not found there, it is loaded via the Session (which should create a proxy, not actually load the entity from the database). Related entities are Promoted in the saveOrder according to their state.
member.param: Name of the navigation/association property of the entity, e.g. "Customer". May be null if the property is the entity's identifier.
Type of the property
Breeze EntityInfo
Metadata for the entity class

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHRelationshipFixer.MaybeAddToGraph(Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo,Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo,NHibernate.Type.EntityType)
member.summary: Add the parent-child relationship for certain propType conditions

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHRelationshipFixer.FindForeignKey(System.String,NHibernate.Metadata.IClassMetadata)
member.summary: Find a foreign key matching the given property, by looking in the fkMap. The property may be defined on the class or a superclass, so this function calls itself recursively.
member.param: Name of the property e.g. "Product"
Class metadata, for traversing the class hierarchy
member.returns: The name of the foreign key, e.g. "ProductID"

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHRelationshipFixer.GetForeignKeyValue(Breeze.ContextProvider.EntityInfo,NHibernate.Metadata.IClassMetadata,System.String)
member.summary: Get the value of the foreign key property. This comes from the entity, but if that value is null, and the entity is deleted, we try to get it from the originalValuesMap.
member.param: Breeze EntityInfo
Metadata for the entity class
Name of the foreign key property of the entity, e.g. "CustomerID"

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHRelationshipFixer.GetPropertyValue(NHibernate.Metadata.IClassMetadata,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Return the property value for the given entity.
member.param: If null, the identifier property will be returned.

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHRelationshipFixer.FindInSaveMapById(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Find the matching entity in the saveMap. This is for relationship fixup.
member.param: Type of entity, e.g. Order. The saveMap will be searched for this type and its subtypes.
Key value of the entity
member.returns: The EntityInfo, or null if not found

member.name: M:Breeze.ContextProvider.NH.NHRelationshipFixer.FindInSaveMapByEntity(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Find the matching entity in the saveMap. This is for relationship fixup.
member.param: Type of entity, e.g. Order. The saveMap will be searched for this type and its subtypes.
The entity being found
member.returns: The EntityInfo, or null if not found
